sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is a family-owned and operated full-service fabrication and installation company specializing in residential/commercial: quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. With a second location opening in Springdale, Emcar Stone Studio's increased capacity will enable them to keep bringing exceptional service to the entire Northwest Arkansas region. Reach out today for a free estimate!

posts.title: Explore Local Artistry During Crystal Bridges's Pintura Fest Public Art Pop-Up
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
Opening today, Apr 17, in five venues across Northwest Arkansas, the Pintura Fest Public Art Pop-Up will feature large-scale paintings created by local artists last month during Crystal Bridges' Pintura Fest.

  • Art Fiesta: On Mar 18, Pintura Fest was a community fiesta celebrating the opening of Crystal Bridges' new exhibition Diego Rivera's America. Six regional artists, art teachers, and students from 10 schools created 17 large-scale paintings in front of a live audience.
  • In The Community: Art pop-ups will be displayed at The Jones Center, Rogers Experimental House, Rogers City Hall, Fayetteville Public Library, and Siloam Springs Public Library. At each site, visitors are encouraged to pick up a free art kit that includes at-home projects, a community guide, and an exhibition admission voucher for Diego Rivera's America at Crystal Bridges.

Learn more about the Pintura Fest Public Art Pop-Up HERE.

posts.title: Support Local Law Enforcement During The Benton County Sheriff's Cup
posts.content:
The Benton County Sheriff's Cup Cocktail Event and Golf Tournament are back for the 3rd year, organized by L.E.A.P. NWA, which provides protective equipment for local law enforcement and offers financial & medical assistance for officers and their families during times of need.

  • Thanks to our sponsors: Sponsors and tournament players are invited to a Cocktail Event on Sunday, Jun 11, from 6-9p, including hors d'oeuvres from Carmelita's Modern Mexican Cuisine, auctions and raffles, live music from Bullet Proof Band, and fun with Ozark Axe Throwing.
  • On the green: The Charity Golf Event at Pinnacle Country Club on Monday, Jun 12, will be a 4-man scramble format with 8a and 1p flight times, lunch provided by Whole Hog Cafe, and prizes will be awarded for 1st and 2nd place in each flight, hole-in-ones, closest to pins, longest drives, and more.

Purchase sponsorship packages HERE and register for the Golf Tournament HERE.

posts.title: Honor Flight Of The Ozarks Extends Service To Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Honor Flight of the Ozarks has extended its reach to include Benton and Washington Counties, allowing the veterans of Northwest Arkansas to be honored with a day trip to Washington, D.C., for a tour of the capital's memorials.

  • Memorial tour: The Honor Flight Network is a nationwide nonprofit made up of independent, regional hubs which give veterans an opportunity to witness the nation's monuments that were built in their honor. An estimated 43,000 veterans live in Benton and Washington Counties combined.
  • In the service: Veterans who served in World War II, the Korean War, the Vietnam War, Desert Shield/Storm, or any veterans who are critically ill are eligible for an Honor Flight. The first Honor Flight of the Ozarks will take off on May 17. The May flight is full, but registrations are open for the Aug 23 and Oct 25 flights.

If you know an eligible veteran, connect them with Honor Flight of the Ozarks HERE.

posts.title: Celebrate Earth Day At Botanical Garden Of The Ozarks
posts.content:
The community is coming together for the Earth Day Festival at the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks in Fayetteville on Friday, Apr 21, from 3-6p, including family-friendly activities, booths from community partners, live music, and a magic show!

  • Animal kingdom: See live snakes up close with the Ozark Natural Science Center, feed goats with Greedy Goats NWA, feel the pelts of "Arkansas Critters" with the Ozark Highland Nature Center, make a "sun print" with the Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, and more.
  • Bring me a shrubbery: The City of Fayetteville will be giving away free trees and shrubs while supplies last, and guests are encouraged to bring a picnic to enjoy in the Garden during this celebration of our environment.

Admission is $10 for adults, $5 for kids ages 4-12, and free for children 3 and under. Reserve tickets HERE.

posts.title: Gear Garden Re-Opens This Weekend For 2023 Season
posts.content:
Arkansas's most unique beer garden, Gear Garden in Bella Vista, is re-opening for the 2023 season and throwing a party all weekend long, Apr 21-23, with food trucks, live music, and more.

  • The watering hole: With access to miles of hiking and biking trails near Blowing Springs, the Gear Garden offers a refreshing stop to enjoy cold beverages and other refreshments; all served from a refurbished shipping container.
  • Party on: Each day this weekend will feature live performances and a chance for visitors to take advantage of opening weekend merchandise, like Garden Growlers, pioneer cups, and new jerseys!

Find more details about the event HERE.
